intro: Saxifraga prattii var. prattii, commonly known as the alpine saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb with a compact rosette of fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Saxifraga prattii var. prattii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens.
